result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole Lynn Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
-Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
-Pay restitution if requested.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: -Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Lynn Howard

defendant.name: Howard, Nicole Lynn
defendant.address: 1417 Fourth Ave A, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.addlTxt: Filed by Prosecutor.
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by Atty Eric Sheets
Victim Impact Statement from D.A.S. filed by the State

8:42 AM Defendant Nicole Lynn Howard in court.  Attorney (Atty) Eric Sheets in court for Nicole Lynn Howard.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement and no restitution is being requested.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: 961.31(3g)(b) Misdemeanor Possess Controlled Substance - No Contest
Count 2: 947.01(1) Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct - No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of amended counts 1 & 2
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victims are not present but they approve the agreement as stated. 

ADA Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Sheets concurs with the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes apologetic statement. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Serve 30 days in jail 
 No days credit.
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of  24 months.
Conditions of Probation: 
-AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
-Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
-Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
-Pay restitution if requested.
-Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
-Pay costs and surcharges

Count 2:
Serve 60 days in jail, concurrent with Count 1. 
 No days credit.
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of  24 months.
Conditions of Probation: 
-Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.
-Pay costs and surcharges.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Filed by Prosecutor.

filed by Atty Eric Sheets

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:34 PM Defendant Nicole Lynn Howard in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Nicole Lynn Howard. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Written waiver filed by Atty Sheets.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
